metadata.title: CVE-2022-42720 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
Various refcounting bugs in the multi-BSS handling in the mac80211 stack inthe Linux kernel 5.1 through 5.19.x before 5.19.16 could be used by localattackers (able to inject WLAN frames) to trigger use-after-free conditionsto potentially execute code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-42720` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic - 5.19.0-23.24
linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-23.24
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic - 5.19.0-23.24
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic-64k - 5.19.0-23.24
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-aws - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-azure - 5.19.0-1010.11
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-gcp - 6.2.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1001-ibm - 6.2.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1003.3
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency-64k - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-oracle - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi - 6.2.0-1004.5
linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 6.2.0-1004.5
No subscription required
